summary: U.S. foreign partners buy billions of dollars of defense equipment and services each year through the U.S. Foreign Military Sales program. The program charges fees to purchasers to cover the U.S. government's cost of operating the program. As the value of these sales has increased, the balances in the 2 main fee accounts have grown in excess of 950% and now top $5 billion. We...
title: Foreign Military Sales: Controls Should Be Strengthened to Address Substantial Growth in Overhead Account Balances
